pkgmetadata.longdescription: Identifying Patient Social Risk from Administrative Health Care Data // Social risks are increasingly becoming a critical component of health care research. One of the most common ways to identify social needs is by using ICD-10-CM "Z-codes." This package identifies social risks using varying taxonomies of ICD-10-CM Z-codes from administrative health care data. The conceptual taxonomies come from: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (2021) https://www.cms.gov/files/document/zcodes-infographic.pdf, Reidhead (2018) https://www.mhanet.com/mhaimages/Policy_Briefs/ PolicyBrief_SDOH.pdf, A Arons, S DeSilvey, C Fichtenberg, L Gottlieb (2018) https://sirenetwork.ucsf.edu/tools- resources/resources/compendium-medical-terminology-codes- social-risk-factors.
